page.title: 03THE CHANGING TIMES
page.content: {The Changing Times} We interviewed Mrs Coulson who has lived in this area since she was born and moved to Waddingam fifty years ago.This is what she told us when we asked her what life was like then. {1935}Fifty years ago there was a draper's shop, a butcher's shop, Post Office and a cobbler's in Waddingham.Milk was taken from Beckside Farm to a neighbouring village to be sterilized.It was then brought back by horse and cart and sold by the pint and the half pint.It was 3.5d for one pint.Bread was baked in village at the mill and taken round the village hot.A loaf of bread cost 4d.There was a coal merchant in the village who came round selling coal in a lorry at 2s4d a bag.
